snippet: In a flier distributed to operators, the Transport Workers Union Local 100 said that preventing a subway accident “is worth a few extra minutes on your trip.”
abstract: Union representing New York City subway operators distributes flier advising its workers to drastically reduce trains speed as they enter stations, directive prompted by recent deaths of two people who were shoved in front of oncoming subway trains; Metropolitan Transportation Authority has opposed any speed change and said that any effort to comply with the flier would be a violation of work rules.
lead_paragraph: In a flier distributed to operators, the Transport Workers Union Local 100 said that preventing a subway accident “is worth a few extra minutes on your trip.”

headline.seo: Union of Subway Drivers Urges Slower Train Speeds
